description.narrative: Accelerator Lab - Lao PDR: The network will surface and reinforce locally sourced solutions at scale while mobilizing a wide and dynamic partnership of actors contributing knowledge, resources and experience.

activity-description.narrative: Lab based in UN House, Vientiane

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses 2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies 3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative: 1.1 7 new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 6 different data sources used 1.3 50 sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 10 methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. 2.1 At least 8 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. 3.1 48 interaction with the lab network per year 3.2 50% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 At least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. 3.4 Identify 7 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

1.1 12 new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2. 7 different data sources used 1.3 44 sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 13 methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. 2.1 At least 10 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year 2.2 100% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 one internal partner (CO) has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 100% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. 3.1 At least 50 interaction with the lab network per year 3.2 50% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 At least 1 time per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. 3.4 12 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

1.1 30 local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by the labs using new methods 1.2 8 experiments undertaken by the labs 1.3 80% coherence among hypotheses (variation among types of experiments run by the labs) 2.1 15% of lead innovators (surfaced through solutions mapping) whose ideas that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming [disaggregated by sex, rural urban, and country typology] 2.2 10% solutions surfaced through collective intelligence methods that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming 3.1 8 new models, approaches and insights from lab network documented and disseminating through working out loud 3.2 5 methods for solutions mapping, collective intelligence and experimentation developed, codified disseminated 3.3 30% of solutions adapted or inspired from one country accelerator lab to another and among all UNDP country offices 3.4 20% of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the portfolio of experiments of the Accelerator Labs.

1.1 45 local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by the labs using new methods 1.2 12 experiments undertaken by the labs 1.3 80% coherence among hypotheses (variation among types of experiments run by the labs) 2.1 12% of lead innovators (surfaced through solutions mapping) whose ideas that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming [disaggregated by sex, rural urban, and country typology] 2.2 12% solutions surfaced through collective intelligence methods that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming 3.1 8 new models, approaches and insights from lab network documented and disseminating through working out loud 3.2 5 methods for solutions mapping, collective intelligence and experimentation developed, codified disseminated 3.3 20% of solutions adapted or inspired from one country accelerator lab to another and among all UNDP country offices 3.4 25% of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the portfolio of experiments of the Accelerator Labs.

1.1 5 new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 5 different data sources used 1.3 25 sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 5 methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. 2.1 At least 8 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. 3.1 48 interaction with the lab network per year 3.2 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 At least once per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. 3.4 Identify 7 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.
